books.title: Pierre and Jean
books.author: Guy de Maupassant
books.summary: A doctor, jealous of his brother’s sudden wealth, starts questioning its provenance.

books.title: The Son of the Wolf
books.author: Jack London
books.summary: A collection of stories entailing life during the gold rush in the harsh wilderness of northwestern North America.

books.title: You Can’t Win
books.author: Jack Black
books.summary: Jack Black’s autobiographical account of life “on the road” as a professional thief and hobo during the late 19th century and early 20th century.

books.title: Recollections of Full Years
books.author: Helen Herron Taft
books.summary: Helen Herron Taft, wife of William Howard Taft, the twenty-seventh President of the United States, recalls her life married to one of America’s most influential political figures.

books.title: Darby O’Gill and the Good People
books.author: Herminie Templeton Kavanagh
books.summary: When Tipperary man Darby O’Gill is imprisoned by the fairies of Sleive-na-mon in their home under the hollow mountain, he starts a lasting friendship with their King Brian Connors.

books.title: School Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of Wodehouse’s school stories about the lives and adventures of schoolboys in the early 1900s.

books.title: Agamemnon
books.author: Aeschylus
books.summary: The titular Greek king returns home from the Trojan war to be greeted by his scheming wife, who plots vengeance.

books.title: The Phoenix and the Carpet
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: Five children once again encounter an ancient, magical creature and go on adventures around the world with its magic carpet.

books.title: The Pit
books.author: Frank Norris
books.summary: A couple in turn-of-the-century Chicago navigates the murky waters of greed, ambition, and loss against the backdrop of the Board of Trade’s wheat speculation pits.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Frank Belknap Long
books.summary: A collection of short fiction by Frank Belknap Long, ordered by date of original publication.

books.title: Incidents in the Life of a Slave Girl
books.author: Linda Brent
books.summary: The autobiography of a woman who grew up in, and escaped from, slavery.

books.title: The Viaduct Murder
books.author: Ronald A. Knox
books.summary: A foursome of friends out golfing try to unravel the mystery surrounding a corpse found on the links.

books.title: On the Art of Writing
books.author: Arthur Quiller-Couch
books.summary: Quiller-Couch surveys the history of English prose while dispensing advice for writing tastefully.

books.title: The Rights of Man
books.author: Thomas Paine
books.summary: A philosopher and political activist presents a forceful argument in favor of the principles of the French Revolution and of republicanism in general, together with a condemnation of monarchy and hereditary power in general.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Ambrose Bierce
books.summary: A collection of Ambrose Bierce’s poetry.

books.title: Main Street
books.author: Sinclair Lewis
books.summary: An ambitious young woman chafes against the constraints of small-town America.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Mack Reynolds
books.summary: A collection of science fiction short stories by Mack Reynolds ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Lost Face
books.author: Jack London
books.summary: A collection of short stories by Jack London.

books.title: Unspoken Sermons
books.author: George MacDonald
books.summary: George MacDonald presents a set of interlocking sermons designed to shape the perception and life of the Christian disciple.

books.title: The Innocents Abroad
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: Mark Twain travels abroad, offering witty observations on the places and cultures he encounters and commentary on the habits and foibles of his fellow travelers.
